name: Two Classic Taylors Online Trivia | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Rod Taylor starred in Hitchcock's "The Birds" (1963). Tippi Hedren played the female lead; who played Taylor's old girl friend?
questions.explanation:
Suzanne Pleshette.

	This is one of Rod's best roles. A good Evan Hunter screenplay, based on the story by Daphne DuMaurier. Oh, those birds ...

questions.text: Rod Taylor starred in "36 Hours" (1965) with James Garner. Taylor tries to trick Garner into revealing what secret?
questions.correct: Time and place of the D-Day invasion
options: Time and place of a meeting between Churchill and Roosevelt
Information regarding development of the A-bomb
questions.explanation:
Time and place of the D-Day invasion.

	This is a clever idea that works well in the first half of the movie and then loses steam. John Banner ("Hogan's Heroes") has a small role; Eva MArie Saint plays "the girl".

questions.text: Rod Taylor had one of his best roles in "The Time Machine" (1960). Which statement is accurate?
questions.correct: The morlocks lived underground and were savage
options: The morlocks lived above ground and were savage
The eloi lived underground and were savage
The eloi lived above ground and were savage
questions.explanation:
The morlocks lived underground and were savage.

	This is a fun movie to watch, largely because of Rod's style in the lead role.

questions.text: Rod Taylor played the title role in "Young Cassidy" (1965). The movie is based on the life of what writer?
questions.explanation:
Sean O'Casey.

	O'Casey was an irish playwright of some note.

questions.text: Rod Taylor starred in "Sunday in New York" (1963). Who was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Candice Bergen.

	Jane Fonda played the female lead in this cute comedy. Robertson played her brother and Culp played her boy friend.

questions.text: Robert Taylor had one of his best roles in "Ivanhoe" (1952). Which of these dramatic events is NOT in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Naval battle.

	Ivanhoe is injured in a jousting tournament, Liz is put on trial for witchcraft; she is ultimately rescued by siege of the castle. (There are, however, no naval battles.)

questions.text: Robert Taylor starred in a movie based on which of these legends of the American West?
questions.explanation:
Billy the Kid.

	The movie "Billy the Kid" (1941) takes liberty with historical facts - of course. Nevertheless, it's an entertaining western.

questions.text: Robert Taylor starred as "A Yank at ____ " (1938)?
questions.explanation:
Oxford.

	Robert tries his hand at comedy in this one.

questions.text: What role did Robert Taylor play in "Quo Vadis" (1951)?
questions.explanation:
Roman soldier.

	This is a "religious epic" of sorts. Not in the class of Ben-Hur (but most films aren't in that class).

questions.text: Who was Robert Talyor's leading lady in "Waterloo Bridge" (1940)?
questions.explanation:
Vivien Leigh.

	Another tale of doomed romance. Liz Taylor and Joan Fontaine were in "Ivanhoe"; Garbo starred with Robert in "Camille".
